intro: Milla conspicua, commonly known as the showy milla, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to deep purple. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky slopes, thriving in cool, temperate climates.
